definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: This supercilious attitude relegates me to the level of the commonplace.
sentences.chinese: 這種目空一切的心態把我歸入大路貨的檔次。

sentences.english: Therefore, don't cavalierly refused a seemingly low salary job.
sentences.chinese: 因此，千萬別目空一切地拒絕一份看似低薪的工作。

sentences.english: Such brashness is typical in Wenzhou.
sentences.chinese: 這種目空一切的態度在溫州很常見。

sentences.english: The contumacious mob shouted defiantly at the police.
sentences.chinese: 暴徒的頑皮喊道目空一切的警察。

sentences.english: Dr. A is the man with supercilious overconfidence.
sentences.chinese: 醫生是目空一切過於自信的人。

definition: to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to think of oneself as terrific (idiom); arrogant
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
